instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U4900: What is U4900? This is the System Management Controller(SMC) in older(pre-2013) macbooks.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PLT_RESET: What is PLT_RESET? PLT_RESET stands for platform reset. When this is asserted the machine will not POST. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .

threads.title: <SIGNAL>820_3115</SIGNAL>-B <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
HI there. I have an intermittent issue with this board that I am able to replicate. Currently its pulling 130ma off the charger @18.5V. There was no liquid damage on this board. If I unplug and re-insert the magsafe (off the DC power supply set @19V) over and over, eventually this board will turn on. When it doesnt turn on, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> fluctuates 7-9V, and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0v, all other voltages are within spec. It seems as though it will only turn on with a genuine 85W power supply, and not the 60W. IT will not stay powered on very long running off battery (too low voltage?)

I have replaced:
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>
<CHIP>U4900</CHIP>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR>
<TRANSISTOR>Q7950</TRANSISTOR>

Connecting a genuine 60W magsafe - No boot
Connecting a genuine 85W Magsafe - Boot
DC Power supply set @ 16.5V - No boot
DC Power supply set @ 19V - Boot (but sometimes not)

What should I be checking next?

threads.title: <SIGNAL>820_3115</SIGNAL>-B <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and R/<CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>820_3115</SIGNAL>-B <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7025</RESISTOR>,<CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR>. Resistance is 3.2ohms@ pins17/18, 20.1ohms @ pins 27/28. This appears to be normal. There is no change to boot (no power up @16.5v) powers up fine @19v. PPBUS+G3H is now normal @12.6v after these components have been replaced. <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET</SIGNAL> is still low (0.22v) and the green light on the charger slightly flickers while plugged in @16.5V (the same as when doing an SMC reset)

threads.title: <SIGNAL>820_3115</SIGNAL>-B <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Do you always get <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>?
Check if it always start in SMC bypass mode.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>820_3115</SIGNAL>-B <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: 3.42 is always present. Board will turn on if I press power button with 60W magsafe connected, just not by itself. Board will boot in SMC bypass.

threads.title: <SIGNAL>820_3115</SIGNAL>-B <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board should turn on by itself when charger is connected, if battery is not present.

Do you get now 12.6V at <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with 60W charger alone?
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> come up?
Just in case, check PCH's RTC signals.
